metadata.source: Harpswell Neck Fire Department Training Video

K.name: Cabinet K
K.description: Main critical equipment cabinet - contains 7 of 12 critical items

access.inside: Through glass doors from patient compartment
access.outside: External door on ambulance side - PRIMARY ACCESS ON SCENE

items.name: Adult Trauma Bag
items.description: Contains all trauma supplies for adult patients

items.name: Adult Oxygen Kit
items.position: Behind adult trauma bag in middle drawer
items.description: Complete respiratory treatment kit with oxygen

items.name: Pediatric Oxygen Kit
items.description: Pediatric respiratory kit - placed FIRST because children primarily have respiratory emergencies
items.notes: Kids rarely have cardiac problems - respiratory is primary concern
items.reasoning: Oxygen for children is of PRIMARY importance

items.name: Pediatric Trauma Bag
items.position: BEHIND pediatric oxygen kit in lower drawer

top_shelf.type: fixed shelf - does not pull out

items.name: IV Bag/Kit
items.description: Everything to establish IV access for paramedic drug administration
items.notes: Does NOT contain saline bags - primarily for medication administration access

items.name: Portable AED
items.color: Black bag with red 'AED' lettering and yellow-green reflective strip
items.position: Top shelf of Cabinet K - further back
items.description: Automated External Defibrillator for cardiac emergencies
items.status_indicator: Green flash every 8-10 seconds means charged and ready
items.check_requirement: EMTs must verify green flash during checks

J.name: Cabinet J
J.description: Located directly above Cabinet K inside ambulance
J.access: Inside patient compartment - above Cabinet K

items.name: Drug Box
items.driver_note: Driver only needs to know: ORANGE BOX = DRUG BOX. Nothing more.

items.name: Portable Suction Unit
items.charging_location: Plugged into cigarette lighter at back of cabinet
items.CRITICAL_WARNING: Cord does NOT detach at unit! MUST unplug from cigarette lighter before removing. Pulling without unplugging is like driving away from gas pump with nozzle in tank.
items.notes: One of THREE suction types on board

N.name: Drawer N
N.description: EMT medications and diagnostic equipment drawer

items.name: Glucometer
items.position: Always in exact same place in Drawer N
items.description: Checks blood glucose levels in diabetic patients
items.driver_note: Little black box, little black pouch - always in same spot

items.name: Narcan/Naloxone
items.description: Opioid overdose reversal medication - delivered intranasally
items.packaging_new: Clear tube - can see syringe inside
items.CRITICAL_COMPONENT: Nasal atomizer MUST come with syringe - they are taped together
items.administration: Atomizer screws onto syringe tip, plunger creates atomized spray for nasal absorption
items.warning: Syringe alone is worthless without atomizer - cannot just squirt liquid
items.additional_location: More Narcan also in Drug Box but Drawer N is fastest access

items.name: EMT Authorized Medications
items.description: All medications EMT can administer under scope or with online medical control
items.notes: Medical control phone numbers posted on drawer

D.name: Cabinet D
D.description: Saline and IV fluids storage - accessible by walking around foot of stretcher
D.access: Inside patient compartment - easily accessible without climbing over equipment
D.access_tip: Cabinet doors can be FOLDED DOWN for easier access - push down then open

items.name: Saline Bags
items.moved_from: Previously in Cabinet K but moved for accessibility
items.reason_moved: With patient hooked to LifePak (pulse ox, BP cuff, 12-lead), couldn't access K without pole vault or limbo

items.name: Primary Sets
items.position: Right next to saline bags in Cabinet D
items.CRITICAL_NOTE: MUST grab primary set WITH saline bag - bag is USELESS without tubing
items.description: Tubing with needle for saline bag, ports for IV connection

items.name: Heated IV Warmer
items.seasonal_use: Winter - warm saline for hypothermic patients
items.summer_note: In summer, ambient heat already warms saline sufficiently
items.reasoning: Patient will be inside ambulance when saline is used

oxygen_tank_storage.name: Spare Oxygen Tank Storage
oxygen_tank_storage.description: Next to steps on side entry of ambulance
oxygen_tank_storage.access: Inside patient compartment - near side door steps

items.name: Spare Oxygen Tanks

old_style.operation: 1. Open main stem/first stage valve 2. Then set flow rate on regulator yoke
old_style.gauge_note: Shows 0 until valve opened, actually has ~2000 PSI
old_style.status: Last one remaining - use up first

new_style_matheson.operation: Just turn top valve to set flow - that's it
new_style_matheson.gauge: Shows internal pressure immediately without opening valve

items.release_mechanism: SQUEEZE brackets together to release (counterintuitive - not pull apart)
items.duration_warning: At 15 liters/minute, tank only lasts a few minutes

items.name: LifePak 15
items.description: Cardiac monitor/defibrillator - records vitals, EKG, pulse ox, blood pressure

handling.warning: VERY EXPENSIVE - handle carefully, do not drop
handling.removal: Two small posts stick up from base - pull unit off posts
handling.carrying: Carry with sensitive side (screen/controls) against your body for protection
handling.other_side: Has extra blood pressure cuffs and batteries - can take some bumps

startup.driver_task: Press green button ONCE briefly when requested - unit will boot up
startup.benefit: Ready to use immediately on scene - just connect pulse ox or BP cuff

shutdown_warning.DO_NOT_SHUTDOWN: After hospital delivery during cleanup, do NOT turn off LifePak
shutdown_warning.reason: One button press of 'Code Summary' prints entire transport record
shutdown_warning.benefit: Paper printout makes report writing much easier
shutdown_warning.cloud_upload: If left on, can send data to cloud for automatic report download
shutdown_warning.accidental_shutdown_prevention: Single tap won't shut it off - must press AND HOLD
shutdown_warning.if_shutdown: Code summary still accessible but requires multiple steps

mc2_backseat.name: MC2 Back Seat
mc2_backseat.description: Passenger seat area of MC2 chase vehicle

items.name: LUCAS Device
items.description: Mechanical CPR device - delivers consistent chest compressions
items.securing: Secured with seatbelt ONLY (not strapped 16 ways)
items.removal: Hit seatbelt release, then access LUCAS
items.ownership: Purchased by Town of Harpswell for MC2
items.reasoning: MC2 usually first on scene. OBI has another LUCAS but is 23 minutes away from Ash Point
items.department_inventory: Harpswell has 2 LUCAS devices total (MC2 and OBI)

onboard_suction.name: Onboard Suction System
onboard_suction.description: Built-in suction unit in patient compartment

items.name: Onboard Suction Unit
items.description: Vacuum pump driven suction for patients on stretcher
items.notes: One of THREE suction types on board (with portable and manual)

critical_items_summary.location: Cabinet K - Middle Drawer (behind trauma bag)
Cabinet K - Lower Drawer (behind oxygen kit)

red_tags.meaning: If seal unbroken, contents unchanged from last inventory
red_tags.benefit: Saves Scott enormous time on weekly inventories

blue_tags.meaning: Tracks drugs coming in or out of drug box
blue_tags.requirement: EMT must record under drug law

types.name: Portable Suction
types.warning: Unplug from cigarette lighter before removing

driver_quick_reference.when_asked_for_item: If unsure where something is, ASK - EMT will direct you

critical_locations.Cabinet K (outside access): 7 critical items - trauma bags, oxygen kits, intubation, IV, AED

lifepak_instructions.on_request: Press green button once briefly to turn on
lifepak_instructions.after_hospital: Do NOT turn off - EMT needs code summary printout
